items.name: Intel Core i7-14700K
items.specs: 20 cores / 28 threads, up to 5.6 GHz, LGA 1700 socket
items.paragraph: The Intel Core i7-14700K delivers outstanding performance with its 20 cores and 28 threads, capable of speeds up to 5.6GHz. It’s ideal for gamers, streamers, and creators who demand fast multitasking and high-end computing power.

items.name: AMD Ryzen 7 7800X3D
items.specs: 8 cores / 16 threads, 5.0 GHz boost, AM5 socket
items.paragraph: The Ryzen 7 7800X3D features advanced 3D V-Cache technology, providing exceptional gaming performance and efficiency. With 8 cores and 16 threads, it’s one of the best CPUs for smooth gameplay and creative workloads.

items.name: AMD Ryzen 5 7600
items.specs: 6 cores / 12 threads, 5.1 GHz boost, AM5 socket
items.paragraph: Designed for solid all-around performance, the Ryzen 5 7600 delivers fast processing speeds with 6 cores and 12 threads. It’s perfect for gamers and content creators seeking a great balance between power and affordability.

items.name: Intel Core i5-14600K
items.specs: 14 cores / 20 threads, up to 5.3 GHz, LGA 1700 socket
items.paragraph: This CPU combines strong multi-core performance and energy efficiency, running up to 5.3GHz. Great for gaming and productivity, it’s a dependable choice for performance-focused PC builds.

items.name: Intel Xeon W7-2495X
items.specs: 24 cores / 48 threads, up to 4.8 GHz, LGA 4677 socket
items.paragraph: The Xeon W7-2495X is a workstation-grade CPU with 24 cores and 48 threads built for rendering, AI, and data-heavy applications. It ensures reliability and performance for professional computing environments.

items.name: AMD EPYC 9754
items.paragraph: With a massive 128 cores and 256 threads, the AMD EPYC 9754 is a powerhouse for servers and enterprise workloads. It’s engineered for high scalability, virtualization, and data center efficiency.

items.name: Intel Celeron G5905
items.paragraph: The Celeron G5905 offers reliable performance for basic computing tasks. Its 2 cores and 3.5GHz speed make it great for office use, browsing, and lightweight applications.

items.name: AMD Athlon 3000G
items.paragraph: A budget-friendly dual-core processor that delivers solid everyday performance. With integrated Radeon graphics, it’s ideal for home and entry-level gaming PCs.

items.name: Snapdragon X Elite
items.specs: 12 cores, up to 4.3 GHz, integrated Adreno GPU
items.paragraph: Built for mobility and efficiency, the Snapdragon X Elite features 12 cores and an integrated Adreno GPU. It provides exceptional performance for AI-driven tasks, laptops, and lightweight devices.

items.name: Apple M3 Max
items.paragraph: Apple’s M3 Max chip brings powerful performance with its 16-core CPU and 40-core GPU. Optimized for creative professionals, it offers blazing-fast speeds for design, video editing, and development.

items.name: MediaTek Dimensity 9300
items.paragraph: The Dimensity 9300 combines performance and efficiency using TSMC’s 4nm process. It’s made for flagship smartphones, offering lightning-fast speeds and great battery management.

items.name: Samsung Exynos 2400
items.paragraph: Samsung’s Exynos 2400 features a 10-core CPU and advanced Xclipse GPU for next-gen mobile gaming and photography. It delivers smooth multitasking and impressive energy efficiency.

items.name: Intel Pentium Gold G7400
items.paragraph: A dependable dual-core processor with speeds up to 3.7GHz. The Pentium Gold G7400 is a solid choice for budget desktops and office setups.

items.name: AMD FX-8350
items.paragraph: The AMD FX-8350 remains a classic choice for budget builders, featuring 8 cores and high clock speeds. It’s well-suited for multitasking, older games, and productivity use.

items.name: IBM Power10
items.specs: 15 cores / 30 threads, up to 4.0 GHz, enterprise socket
items.paragraph: The IBM Power10 is an enterprise-level CPU built for maximum reliability and scalability. It’s designed to handle complex workloads in data centers and cloud environments.

items.name: VIA Nano X2
items.paragraph: Compact and energy-efficient, the VIA Nano X2 offers dual-core performance for embedded and small computing systems. It’s a practical option for low-power applications.

items.name: ARM Neoverse N1
items.paragraph: The ARM Neoverse N1 delivers cloud-grade performance with 64 cores and 7nm efficiency. It’s perfect for servers and edge computing solutions requiring low latency and scalability.

items.name: Fujitsu SPARC64 XII
items.paragraph: Engineered for mission-critical operations, the SPARC64 XII offers 12 high-speed cores with enterprise reliability. It’s tailored for demanding business and industrial applications.

items.name: Intel Itanium 9700
items.paragraph: A high-end enterprise processor designed for stability and legacy systems. With 8 cores and 32MB cache, it excels in secure and data-intensive operations.

items.name: MIPS R4700
items.paragraph: A classic 64-bit CPU known for its efficiency and simplicity. The MIPS R4700 is often used in embedded devices, research projects, and educational environments.
